title: God's Omniscience and Omnipresence
shortSummary: Psalm 139 is a profound meditation on God's intimate knowledge of and presence with His people. David expresses awe at God's omniscience, omnipresence, and creative power, while also seeking God's guidance and purification. This chapter highlights the personal relationship between God and the believer, emphasizing God's care from conception through all of life.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the Psalm, expressing his personal reflection on God's knowledge and presence in his life.

definitions.definition: Expressions referring to all daily activities, symbolizing the totality of one's life and actions.
An ancient term referring to the inner parts or kidneys, often symbolizing the seat of emotions and conscience.
A complete and righteous hatred against sin and those who oppose God, reflecting holy zeal.
The eternal path of righteousness and life that leads to fellowship with God forever.

outline.heading: God’s Intimate Knowledge of the Psalmist
outline.description: David acknowledges that God fully knows his actions, thoughts, and words even before they are spoken, highlighting God's infinite understanding that surpasses human comprehension.

outline.heading: God’s Omnipresence
outline.description: David reflects on the impossibility of escaping God's presence, affirming that God is everywhere—whether in heaven, hell, or the farthest seas—guiding and sustaining him.

outline.heading: God’s Creative Power and Care in the Womb
outline.description: The Psalmist praises God for His intricate work in forming him in the womb, emphasizing God’s sovereign design and foreknowledge of his life.

outline.heading: The Preciousness of God’s Thoughts and the Psalmist’s Hatred of the Wicked
outline.description: David marvels at the countless thoughts of God toward him and expresses righteous hatred toward those who oppose God and His name.

outline.heading: A Prayer for Examination and Guidance
outline.description: David invites God to search his heart and lead him away from wickedness, demonstrating a desire for holiness and eternal fellowship with God.

application: Trust in God’s complete knowledge of your life and rest in His intimate care, knowing nothing about you is hidden from Him.
Seek God’s presence continually, confident that He is always near to guide and uphold you in every circumstance.
Praise God for His creative work in your life and honor Him as your Maker who knows you fully from the beginning.
Invite God to examine your heart regularly and lead you away from sin into the everlasting way.

keyVerses.text: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.
keyVerses.significance: This verse introduces the theme of God’s intimate knowledge of the believer, setting the tone for the entire Psalm.

keyVerses.text: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence? If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
keyVerses.significance: These verses powerfully affirm God’s omnipresence, assuring believers that God is always with them.

keyVerses.text: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
keyVerses.significance: This verse celebrates God’s creative power and the unique value of each human life, inspiring worship and gratitude.

keyVerses.text: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
keyVerses.significance: A heartfelt prayer for God’s cleansing and guidance, encouraging believers to seek holiness and eternal life.
